page.title: 07Trains used _Rayleigh Stn.
page.content: 4/8/12 coach E.M.U's are used. The oldest units date from 1959. Class 302/305/307/308/312/&315 units Class 315 are' sliding door' 2nd class They are used off peak and on Sundays Each unit has 4 motors. Overhead 25k/w power is used. Most units are modernised. Trains go up to 90 m.p.h. Each train has a driver and guard. There is one coal train per day. There is one postal train per day. These are Diesel powered. Class 31/37/or47 pull these trains. Signalling is automatic. The main repair depot is at Ilford. A full train carries 300 (seated). Toilets are available on trains. Waiting rooms are on the station. There are 1st and 2nd class. Trains are frequently vandalised. Rayleigh station makes a profit.
